sessionMessages.name: Debug
sessionMessages.description: A debug packet can be sent by either side of a SoupBinTCP connection at anytime. Debug packets are intended to provide human readable text that may aid in debugging problems. Debug Packets should be ignored by both client and server application software.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

sessionMessages.name: Login Accepted
sessionMessages.description: The SoupBinTCP server sends a Login Accepted Packet in response to receiving a valid Login Request from the client. This packet will always be the first non-debug packet sent by the server after a successful login request.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Login Accepted Packet

fields.name: Session
fields.description: The session ID of the session that is now logged into. Left padded with spaces.

fields.name: Sequence Number
fields.description: The sequence number in ASCII of the next Sequenced Message to be sent. Left padded with spaces.

sessionMessages.name: Login Rejected
sessionMessages.description: The SoupBinTCP server sends this packet in response to an invalid Login Request Packet from the client. The server closes the socket connection after sending the Login Reject Packet. The Login Rejected Packet will be the only non-debug packet sent by the server in the case of an unsuccessful login attempt.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Login Rejected Packet

values.description: Not Authorized. There was an invalid username and password combination in the Login Request Message.
Session not available. The Requested Session in the Login Request Packet was either invalid or not available.

sessionMessages.name: Server Heartbeat
sessionMessages.description: The server should send a Server Heartbeat Packet anytime more than 1 second passes where no data has been sent to the client. The client can then assume that the link is lost if it does not receive anything for an extended period of time.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Server Heartbeat Packet

sessionMessages.name: End of Session
sessionMessages.description: The server will send an End of Session Packet to denote that the current session is finished. The connection will be closed shortly after this packet, and the user will no longer be able to reconnect to the current session.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: End of Session Packet

sessionMessages.name: Login Request
sessionMessages.description:
The SoupBinTCP client must send a Login Request Packet immediately upon establishing a new TCP/IP socket connection to the server.
Client and server must have mutually agreed upon the username and password fields. They provide simple authentication to prevent a client from inadvertently connecting to the wrong server.
Both Username and Password are case-insensitive and should be padded on the right with spaces.
The server can terminate an incoming TCP/IP socket if it does not receive a Login Request Packet within a reasonable period of time (typically 30 seconds).

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Login Request Packet

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password

fields.name: Requested Session
fields.description: Specifies the session the client would like to log into, or all blanks to log into the currently active session.

fields.name: Requested Sequence Number
fields.description: Specifies the next sequence number in ASCII the client wants to receive upon connection, or 0 to start receiving the most recently generated message.

sessionMessages.name: Enter Order
sessionMessages.description:
The Enter Order Message lets you enter a new order into NASDAQ.
Each new order must have an Order Token that is unique for that day and that logical OUCH account. If you send a valid order, you should receive an acknowledgement as an Accepted Message or an Atomically Accepted and Canceled Message. If you send an Enter Order Message with a previously used Order Token, the new order will be ignored.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Sequenced Data Packet

fields.name: Message Type
fields.description: Enter Order Message

fields.name: Order Token
fields.description: As described above in Data Types. You can put any information you like. Token must be day- unique for each OUCH account.

values.description:
Sell short, client affirms ability to borrow
securities in good deliverable form for
delivery within three business days

Sell short exempt, client affirms ability to
borrow securities in good deliverable form for delivery within three business days

fields.name: Shares
fields.description: Total number of shares. Must be greater than zero and less than 1,000,000

fields.name: Stock
fields.description: Stock symbol

fields.name: Price
fields.description: The price of the order.

fields.name: Time in Force
fields.description: The number of seconds that this order should live before being automatically canceled.

fields.name: Firm
fields.description:
This field should contain all caps. Firm Identifier for the order entry firm. One logical OUCH Account can potentially enter orders for multiple firms in a Service Bureau Functionality that is not available will be greyed out in the specifications. Any changes will be conveyed via the NASDAQ OMX Head Trader Alerts or Technical Updates.
configuration. If this field is blank-filled, the default firm for the OUCH Account will be used.

fields.name: Display

values.description: Imbalance-Only (for opening and closing cross only)
Post-Only and Attributeable - Price to Display

fields.description: Display instructions

fields.name: Capacity
fields.description: Order capacity. Values other than 'A', 'P' or 'R' will be converted to 'O'

fields.name: Intermarket Sweep Eligibility
fields.description: Intermarket sweep eligibility

fields.name: Minimum Quantity
fields.description: Specifies the minimum acceptable quantity to execute

fields.name: Cross Type
fields.description: Cross type

fields.name: Customer Type

values.description: Use the default configure on the port for your firm

fields.description: Indicates if the order is a retail designated order (optional field)

sessionMessages.name: Client Heartbeat
sessionMessages.description: The client should send a Client Heartbeat Packet anytime more than 1 second passes where no data has been sent to the server. The server can then assume that the link is lost if it does not receive anything for an extended period of time.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Client Heartbeat Packet

sessionMessages.name: Logout Request
sessionMessages.description: The client may send a Logout Request Packet to request the connection be terminated. Upon receiving a Logout Request Packet, the server will immediately terminate the connection and close the associated TCP/IP socket.

fields.name: Packet Length
fields.description: Number of bytes after this field until the next packet

fields.name: Packet Type
fields.description: Logout Request Packet
